1498457866331734017.text: As we mark the end of #BlackHistoryMonth 2022, I hope the Senate will join the House soon and send the Emmett Till Antilynching Act to @POTUS' desk to be signed, at long last, into law.

1498457865257988097.text: Lynchings have terrorized our country since its founding, from the era of slavery through the days of Jim Crow and the Civil Rights Movement.  In particular, they have targeted African Americans and have been used to sow terror in African-American communities nationwide.

1498457863915720705.text: This evening, the House voted to make lynching a federal hate crime through the Emmett Till #AntilynchingAct, as we did with last Congress with a strong bipartisan vote. I want to thank my friend @RepBobbyRush for leading this charge over the years. https://t.co/v0rA5Q19zR

1498444248970051590.text: I am proud to support @RepGwenMoore’s bill to bestow Congress’ highest honor on members of Six Triple Eight, the only all-Black Women’s Army Corps Battalion to serve overseas in WWII. As we observe #BHM, this bill is a crucial reminder that black history is American history.

1498416303551533057.text: The #CROWNAct would prohibit discrimination on the basis of hair texture & style, which disproportionately affects black women across America & has no place in society. I'm proud to bring it to the Floor today & urge strong support from my colleagues on both sides of the aisle. https://t.co/knbbReqQdN

1498375585382514695.text: It is unacceptable that in 2022, lynching is still not designated as a federal hate crime. I urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to join me in voting yes. https://t.co/Hew8KDJQdN

1479116391244435457.text: Those who attacked the Capitol on 1/6 were not themselves patriots; instead, they came face to face with true & honest patriots in the men & women who defended that building & those serving inside to ensure that our Constitution would not perish on that day or any day to follow.

1479116386395770888.text: One year ago today, a dangerous mob of insurrectionists stormed the U.S. Capitol in an attempt to prevent Congress from certifying the results of our country’s free and fair election. Though scarred by this terrible day, our democracy still stood.  https://t.co/ttzXEZMt7F

1432082812467912704.text: I am deeply grateful to the brave men and women of the United States Armed Forces and diplomats who are carrying out our mission under these extraordinarily difficult conditions.

1432082811163455495.text: The safety and security of American citizens and our partners remains of paramount importance and we will continue to hold the Taliban accountable to ensure this commitment.

1432082809905192962.text: I appreciate the Biden Administration’s ongoing communication with our partners and commitment to ensuring Americans and our allies can leave the country following the August 31st deadline.

1432082808575610885.text: The United States will take continued steps to ensure our military personnel can complete our mission, and we must not falter in seeking justice for those killed in the line of duty.

1432082806642028547.text: I continue to support President Biden’s forceful response to the horrific terrorist attack at Hamid Karzai International Airport as well as today’s targeted strike to address an imminent and credible threat to American and Afghan lives. (1/5)

1431756116564844551.text: I continue to thank the members of the Armed Forces and our diplomats who are working tirelessly to evacuate Americans and our Afghan allies under incredibly challenging circumstances.

1431756115310694400.text: They served with dedication and bravery, and their sacrifice will not be forgotten.

1431756114115313666.text: I also join in honoring the lives of the 13 service members who made the ultimate sacrifice on a mission that has saved tens of thousands of innocent civilians.

1431756111259082757.text: This action demonstrates that the U.S. will maintain an effective over-the-horizon counterterrorism capability in Afghanistan and shows we will not hesitate to respond to threats and hold accountable those who attack us.

1431756107765227521.text: I strongly support President Biden’s swift and continuing response to Thursday’s terrorist attack. (1/5)
